org.modelio.api.model

Interface IModelingSession


  • public interface IModelingSession
    This interface represents a project session. A modeling session is used to update a modelio project and to give the right model navigation roots.

    The current modeling session can be accessed using the following API: IModelingSession session = Modelio.getInstance().getModelingSession();

    The IModelingSession interface groups the following features:

    • Transaction management
    • Model change management
    • Model root access
    • MObject status management

    • Method Detail

      • addModelHandler

        void addModelHandler(IModelChangeHandler handler)
        Add a model change listener.

        Handlers can modify the model.

        This model listener is used to be notified of the model structural changes, through the use of the IModelChangeHandler listener class.

        Parameters:
        handler - the model change listener to add.

      • addModelListener

        void addModelListener(IModelChangeListener listener)
        Add a model change handler.

        Added listeners must not modify the model. If model modifications should be done use addModelHandler() method.

        This model listener is used to be notified of the model structural changes, through the use of the IModelChangeListener listener class.

        Parameters:
        listener - the model change listener to add.

      • addStatusHandler

        void addStatusHandler(IStatusChangeHandler handler)
        Add a status change listener.

        Handlers can modify the model.

        This model listener is used to be notified of the model status changes (read/write), through the use of the IStatusChangeHandler listener class.

        Parameters:
        handler - the model change listener to add.

      • addStatusListener

        void addStatusListener(IStatusChangeListener listener)
        Add a status handler.

        Added listeners must not modify the model. If model modifications should be done use addModelHandler() method.

        This model listener is used to be notified of all the model status changes (read/write), through the use of the IStatusChangeListener listener class.

        Parameters:
        listener - the model change listener to add.

      • createTransaction

        ITransaction createTransaction(String transactionName)
        Create a new transaction in the project.

        All the model updates have to be carried out in the context of a transaction, which has to be created, through the use of this method, and Committed via the #commit(ITransaction) method or rollbacked using the #rollback(ITransaction) method.

        Parameters:
        transactionName - A transaction name. This name is just a label that might be displayed in log files, a console or dialog boxes.
        Returns:
        the created transaction.

      • findByAtt

        <T extends MObject> Collection<T> findByAtt(Class<T> metaclass,
                                            String att,
                                            String value)
        Get an element in the model from its metaclass, a meta attribute name and value .
        If "element" is given, every model elements will be checked.
        Parameters:
        metaclass - the metaclass to look for.
        att - the name of the meta attribute to check the value in.
        value - the value to look for in the attribute.
        Returns:
        A model element, or null if no match is found.

      • findByAtt

        Collection<? extends MObject> findByAtt(MClass metaclass,
                                        String att,
                                        String value)
        Get an element in the model from its metaclass, a meta attribute name and value .
        If "element" is given, every model elements will be checked.
        Parameters:
        metaclass - the metaclass to look for.
        att - the name of the meta attribute to check the value in.
        value - the value to look for in the attribute.
        Returns:
        A model element, or null if no match is found.

      • findByClass

        <T extends MObject> Collection<T> findByClass(Class<T> metaclass)
        Get all elements in the model from their metaclass.
        If "element" is given, every model elements will be returned.
        Parameters:
        metaclass - the metaclass to look for.
        Returns:
        A list of all model elements, or null if no match is found.

      • findByClass

        Collection<? extends MObject> findByClass(MClass metaclass)
        Get all elements in the model from their metaclass.
        If "element" is given, every model elements will be returned.
        Parameters:
        metaclass - the metaclass to look for.
        Returns:
        A list of all model elements, or null if no match is found.

      • findElementById

        <T extends MObject> T findElementById(Class<T> metaclass,
                                      String id)
        Get an element in the model from its id and metaclass.
        If "element" is given, every model elements will be checked.
        Parameters:
        metaclass - the metaclass to look for.
        id - the id to look for.
        Returns:
        A model element, or null if no match is found.

      • findElementById

        MObject findElementById(MClass metaclass,
                        String id)
        Get an element in the model from its id and metaclass.
        If "element" is given, every model elements will be checked.
        Parameters:
        id -
        metaclass - the metaclass to look for.
        Returns:
        A model element, or null if no match is found.

      • getMetamodelExtensions

        IMetamodelExtensions getMetamodelExtensions()
        Returns the metamodel extension of the project.

        The metamodel extensions are added by the tool when modules are deployed. It corresponds to the stereotypes, note types and tag types brought by modules.

        Returns:
        the stereotypes, tag types and not types brought by deployed modules.

      • getModel

        IUmlModel getModel()
        Returns the UML Model of the project.

        This method is often used to get the root package using the IUmlModel#getRoot() method

        Returns:
        the UML Model connected to the session.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Get the name of this session.
        Returns:
        the name of this session.

      • getRequirementModel

        IAnalystModel getRequirementModel()
        Returns the Requirement Model of the project.

        The requirement model owns three model roots: the requirement container, the dictionary and the requirement administration models.

        Returns:
        the Requirement Model connected to the session.
